sections.title: How We Want This To Feel
How We Care For Each Other

q01.title: Why I'm dating (right now)
q01.prompt: At this phase, I am dating because (choose any):
examples: Exploration (e.g., seeing what is out there without pressure).
Discernment (e.g., dating intentionally to see if we align).
Long-term potential (e.g., looking for a serious partner).
Companionship (e.g., enjoy shared time but not rushing).

q02.title: What feels comfortable right now
q02.prompt: Right now, I feel most comfortable when dating feels (choose any):
examples: Slow and intentional (e.g., taking time to build trust).
Playful and light (e.g., enjoying fun over heavy talks).
Structured (e.g., knowing when we will see each other next).

q03.title: Too slow (for me)
q03.prompt: A pace that would feel too slow for me right now would look like:
examples: No momentum (e.g., weeks between dates).
Vague plans (e.g., 'let's hang sometime' but no date set).
Lack of depth (e.g., only small talk after several dates).

q04.title: Too fast (for me)
q04.prompt: A pace that would feel too fast for me right now would look like:
examples: Forced exclusivity (e.g., pressure to label it day one).
Love bombing (e.g., intense praise/gifts too early).
Trauma dumping (e.g., sharing deepest wounds on first date).

q05.title: Review point for clarity
q05.prompt: A healthy review point to revisit clarity (expectations, pacing, and whether we want a label) would be:

fields.label: What do you want this review to cover? (choose any)

options.label: Confirm or adjust our “focused on each other” agreement
When it feels natural and I notice a sign

fields.label: What milestone?
fields.placeholder: e.g., first trip together, meeting family

fields.label: What sign would you notice?
fields.placeholder: e.g., feeling ready to be more public, wanting more time together

examples: After 4 dates: Review expectations and physical boundaries.
After 1 month: Review exclusivity and communication style.
After first conflict: Review how we repair and move forward.

q06.title: Check-in cadence
q06.prompt: Ideal cadence and format for intentional check-ins:

fields.label: If something feels off, when do we talk about it? (choose one)

examples: Weekly (e.g., Sunday night check-in over tea).
Bi-weekly (e.g., longer deep dive every other week).
As needed (e.g., we pause whenever one of us feels 'off').

q07.title: Overwhelm pattern
q07.prompt: When I feel unsure or overwhelmed, I tend to (choose any) AND the best way to respond is:

fields.label: What I tend to do (choose any)
Please do NOT assume this means (optional)

examples: I pull inward (e.g., I get quiet). Best response: Gentle presence, don't push.
I seek reassurance (e.g., I ask 'are we okay?'). Best response: Verbal affirmation.
I overthink (e.g., I analyze texts). Best response: Clear direct communication.

q08.title: What safety means
q08.prompt: When I feel safe with you, it usually means (choose any) AND in my own words:

options.label: I feel free to change my mind
Conflict or discomfort won’t mean sudden abandonment

examples: Not rushed (e.g., I have time to process).
Emotionally seen (e.g., my feelings are validated).
Free to leave (e.g., I choose to stay because I want to).

q09.title: Support when stressed
q09.prompt: When I'm stressed, what helps most from you is:

options.label: Shift to something light and grounding

fields.label: If you only do one thing, do this:

examples: Listen (e.g., just hear me out, don't fix).
Help (e.g., take a task off my plate).
Space (e.g., let me decompress alone for an hour).

q10.title: How to share the past
q10.prompt: When we talk about past relationships, I prefer:

options.label: Only if relevant to the present
Slowly over time as trust builds

examples: Slowly (e.g., share stories as they become relevant).
Fully (e.g., lay it all out so there are no surprises).
Relevance only (e.g., only if it impacts us now).

q11.title: Affection that feels best right now
q11.prompt: Right now, the forms of affection that feel best to my nervous system are (choose any):
examples: Subtle touch (e.g., hand on back, sitting close).
holding hands (e.g., connection while walking).
Verbal affection (e.g., hearing 'I appreciate you').

q12.title: Approach for a kiss
q12.prompt: If you want to kiss me, the best approach is (choose one) plus what helps me feel safe in the moment:

options.label: Soft check-in (e.g., "I'd love to kiss you")
Nonverbal cue / pause and let me close the gap

fields.label: Words that land well for me (optional)
If I say 'not yet', the best next move is (optional)

examples: Ask directly (e.g., 'Can I kiss you?').
Non-verbal (e.g., lean in and wait for signal).
Soft check-in (e.g., 'I'm thinking about kissing you').

q13.title: Overwhelm signs and best response
q13.prompt: If I start feeling overwhelmed during affection, my likely signs are (choose any). Then write the best response from you:

fields.label: Describe your other signs
fields.placeholder: e.g., I tend to fidget or change the subject

examples: Private only (e.g., no PDA).
Subtle public (e.g., holding hands is okay).
Comfortable (e.g., arm around shoulder at dinner).

q14.title: Group settings preference
q14.prompt: In group settings (friends, etc.), I prefer we:

options.label: Mostly socialize separately and reconnect at the end

examples: Casual group (e.g., meet at a game night).
One-on-one (e.g., meet my best friend for coffee).
Wait (e.g., only after we are exclusive).

q15.title: Initiative and leadership
q15.prompt: Initiative feels best when (choose one), then add a short explanation so I can do it the way you actually mean it:

fields.label: One example that would feel great (optional):

examples: Private (e.g., no social media posts yet).
Stories (e.g., temporal posts are okay).
Soft launch (e.g., photo of hand/drink, no face).

q16.title: Chosen without pressure
q16.prompt: Something that helps me feel chosen without feeling pressured is:
examples: Wait (e.g., 6 months or serious commitment).
Casual (e.g., brief hello if we bump into them).
Intentional (e.g., planned dinner).

q17.title: A fear I'm willing to name
q17.prompt: A fear I have about dating right now (that I'm willing to name) is:
examples: Partnership (e.g., building a life team).
Adventure (e.g., exploring the world together).
Sanctuary (e.g., a safe place to rest).

q18.title: How we treat this connection
q18.prompt: One sentence that describes how I want us to treat this connection is:
examples: Integrity (e.g., doing what we say).
Growth (e.g., always learning).
Fun (e.g., prioritizing play).

q19.title: Top values (choose up to 5)
q19.prompt: Select and rank the values that feel most important to you in a relationship right now (up to 5). Drag to reorder by priority (top = most important).

fields.label: Select and rank your top values (top = most important)
Why these values matter most right now
fields.placeholder: Optional: share context about your priorities...

examples: Shared faith (e.g., praying together).
Shared values (e.g., kindness and service).
Respect (e.g., honoring different beliefs).

q20.title: Faith and church alignment
q20.prompt: At this stage, faith/church shows up best for me as (choose any):

options.label: Light conversation, keep it warm and simple

examples: Agree (e.g., aligned on major issues).
Respectful debate (e.g., enjoy discussing differences).
Private (e.g., keep politics out of relationship).

q21.title: Physical boundaries and standards (right now)
q21.prompt: Right now, I want our physical boundaries to feel:

options.label: Slow by default; revisit if/when needed
I prefer not to detail everything, but I will say 'not yet' when needed

examples: Rotate (e.g., I get this one, you get next).
Split (e.g., Venmo or separate checks).
Income-based (e.g., whoever earns more pays more).

q22.title: What “defining the relationship” means to me
q22.prompt: When we eventually define the relationship, for me that mainly means (choose any):

options.label: We use a public label (boyfriend/girlfriend, etc.)

examples: Egalitarian (e.g., equal partners in all things).
Traditional (e.g., distinct gender roles).
Fluid (e.g., based on strengths/capacity).

q23.title: Future talk pacing
q23.prompt: Future talk (marriage/kids/life plans) feels best to me when:

options.label: Almost none right now; keep it present-focused
High-level only (values and direction, not timelines)
As it naturally comes up, with no pressure
At a structured checkpoint (after X weeks/dates)

examples: Yes (e.g., active desire for family).
No (e.g., happy as a couple).
Open (e.g., willing to discuss).

q24.title: Roles and leadership expectations
q24.prompt: In a healthy relationship, I'm happiest when leadership looks like:

options.label: Shared leadership (both initiate, both carry load)
One tends to lead more, the other supports more
It depends on context (workload, season of life, stress)
Not sure yet; I want to learn this slowly

examples: Dishonesty (e.g., any lying breaks trust).
Addiction (e.g., untreated substance issues).
Contempt (e.g., mocking or disrespect).

q25.title: My conflict style under stress
q25.prompt: When I'm stressed or hurt, I tend to (choose any):
examples: Sincere apology (e.g., 'I was wrong, I'm sorry').
Changed behavior (e.g., showing you learned).
Listening (e.g., hearing my hurt without defending).

q26.title: What helps me de-escalate
q26.prompt: If we feel tension, the fastest way for me to calm down is (choose any):

options.label: Physical grounding (walk, breathe, hold hands if safe)
Facts-only for a moment (no big emotions)

examples: Withdraw (e.g., I go silent).
Pursue (e.g., I try to fix it immediately).
Analyze (e.g., I want to talk through every detail).

q27.title: Apology and repair language
q27.prompt: Select and rank what makes an apology most meaningful to you. Drag to reorder by importance (top = most important).

options.label: A plan to do better next time

fields.label: What makes an apology feel genuine to you?
fields.placeholder: Optional: share what an ideal repair looks like...

examples: Pause (e.g., 'Can we take 10 mins?').
Hold hands (e.g., physical touch grounds us).
Soft tone (e.g., consciously lowering voice).

q28.title: Not-okay conflict behaviors
q28.prompt: Conflict behaviors that are NOT okay for me (choose any) AND what I want us to do if one happens:

options.label: Threatening breakup to win an argument
Using the past as a weapon

fields.label: In the moment, I want us to (optional)

examples: Curiosity (e.g., 'Help me understand').
Ownership (e.g., 'I contributed to this by...').
Affirmation (e.g., 'We are on the same team').

q29.title: Heavy topics boundaries
q29.prompt: When discussing heavy topics (past, trauma, sensitive history), select and rank your preferences. Drag to reorder by importance (top = most important).

options.label: As needed, but pause at first overwhelm
I need heads-up before heavy topics

fields.label: What helps you stay regulated during hard conversations?
fields.placeholder: Optional: share what works for you...

examples: No name calling.
No leaving without saying when you'll return.
No bringing up resolved past issues.

q30.title: Preferred repair ritual
q30.prompt: After a tough moment, the best ‘repair ritual' for us would be (choose any):

options.label: Reconnect with gentle touch (if both want)
A short summary of what we learned

examples: Within 24 hours.
Before sleep (don't go to bed angry).
When emotions settle (even if it takes a day).

q31.title: Ideal cadence for seeing each other (right now)
q31.prompt: Right now, a healthy cadence for seeing each other would be:

fields.label: Describe your schedule
fields.placeholder: e.g., depends on my work schedule, we plan ahead

examples: Early bird (e.g., up at 6am).
Night owl (e.g., up until 1am).
Flexible (e.g., adapt to schedule).

q32.title: Communication channel preferences
q32.prompt: At this stage, I prefer communication to be mostly:

options.label: Light texts + one call before dates
Texts most days + one call weekly
Mostly in-person; texts only to coordinate

fields.label: What does your mix look like? (1–2 sentences)
fields.placeholder: e.g., quick texts most days, short call the day before we meet

examples: Tidy (e.g., clean as I go).
Cluttered (e.g., disorganized but clean).
Messy (e.g., struggle to keep up).

q33.title: Privacy and sharing boundaries
q33.prompt: Regarding sharing our relationship with friends/social media, I prefer:

fields.label: Explain the context
fields.placeholder: e.g., private at work, open with close friends

examples: Homebody (e.g., prefer nights in).
Social (e.g., out with friends often).
Balanced (e.g., 1-2 nights out/week).

q34.title: Pace of integration (friends/family)
q34.prompt: Introducing deeper parts of life (close friends, family, routines) feels best when:
examples: Pets are family (e.g., sleep in bed).
Pets are pets (e.g., kept off furniture).
No pets.

q35.title: Jealousy triggers (if any)
q35.prompt: When I feel jealousy or insecurity, it's usually triggered by (choose any) AND what helps me most is:

fields.label: What helps most from you (1–2 sentences)

examples: Secure (e.g., rarely jealous).
Anxious (e.g., need reassurance).
Protective (e.g., territorial).

q36.title: What reassurance works best
q36.prompt: Select and rank what helps most when you're feeling insecure. Drag to reorder by importance (top = helps most).

options.label: Clear words ("I like you, I'm here")

fields.label: Context about what helps vs. what doesn't
fields.placeholder: Optional: share more about what works for you...

examples: Consistency (e.g., steady communication).
Transparency (e.g., open phone/schedule).
Proximity (e.g., spending time together).

q37.title: Exclusivity boundary preference
q37.prompt: At this stage, exclusivity feels healthiest when:

options.label: Not yet; we keep it open while exploring
We focus on each other without a formal label
We explicitly agree to be exclusive now
We decide at the review point (from earlier)

examples: Open (e.g., know each other's passcodes).
Private (e.g., phone is personal space).
Balanced (e.g., use around each other freely).

q38.title: Boundaries with other connections
q38.prompt: While we're exploring this, healthy boundaries with other people look like (choose any):

options.label: Friendships are fine; we keep them respectful

examples: Closed chapter (e.g., don't discuss much).
Open book (e.g., comfortable sharing history).
Friends (e.g., exes are still in life).

response_shape_hint.description: Recommended storage: responses keyed by respondent_id then question_id. Do not store names inside the questionnaire definition.

lite.title: Lite
lite.post_timebox_activity: Do something light and enjoyable (board game, dessert, short walk).

full.title: Full
full.post_timebox_activity: Stop and reconnect with play or rest. Do not keep analyzing.
